One day, I wrote 31 hashtags in the description of a post on Instagram. When I hit Publish, the whole description was gone (this is the behaviour of Instagram right now #April2019). Oh, crap! The description was so beautiful and now is gone. \nAfter this sad moment, I had an idea: I should create an app to count the hashtags from a text. This was version 1.0 and it was called Hashtags Counter.

After receiving feedback from a couple of friends, I decided to upgrade the app and add some features. Now looks like a Manager. \nUsing this app, you can compose your posts in the \"Write a post\" section. \nThere you will find some useful tools to Copy, Paste or Clear the text from the input.

After you \"Write a post\", you can Save the post in your local database and every time you need a similar description, you can find it in \"Your saved posts\" section. \nYou can also edit the saved post or create a hashtags lists to have them ready when needed. \nThe possibilities are unlimited.
Go to \"Your saved hashtags\" and populate the list with all your favorite hashtags. \nThen go to \"Write a post\" and use the option \"Insert \#\" to insert into your post your hashtags.
I hope this app will be useful for you. Any feedback can be sent to franciscsilviu2\@gmail.com. Thank you!

Import/Export data - because the app is using a local database created by you, if one day you decide to have the same data on different devices, you should be able to Export data from one phone in a file, then import the file on the other device. \nOther things will follow after your feedback.
My name is Silviu Pal and you can find me everywhere. Just Google my name.\n\nCheers!
